page.title: 04Farming
page.content: Catching Shellfish at Crail. Fishing is still being done from Crail harbour although it is better known now as a subject for artists, often seen on pictorial calendars. Recently part of the harbour wall was rebuilt using original stones. The harbour was also dredged to clear out rotted seaweed which was replaced by sand. There are at present 12 boaats fishing from Crail for crabs and lobsters. The lobsters are sent to Eyemouth and from there to the Continent, and the crabs are sent to canneries near Berwick. Some are kept for the summer tourists. The shellfish are caught in creels like cages, made by the fishermen from coarse netting on wooden frames.
